Product Title: High Road to China
Review Date: 2016/11/13
Store: Tom Selleck  (Actor),     Bess Armstrong  (Actor),     Brian G. Hutton  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Action & Adventure
Product Description: ["Take the high road to adventure with Tom Selleck and Bess Armstrong in this freewheeling action-comedy set in the Roaring Twenties. Selleck stars as Patrick O'Malley, a boozing, washed-up aviator who meets his match when he's hired by a high-strung heiress to find her long lost father. They make their way eastward in O'Malley's WWI biplane, surviving narrow escapes, last second rescues, and combat with warlords along the way. But nothing tops the ongoing battle they have with each other - the one which leads inevitably to romance."]
Average Rating: 4.6

reference_summary:
The Soldier VHS
Ken Wahl  (Actor),     Alberta Watson  (Actor),     James Glickenhaus  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: VHS Tape
Movies & TV, Studio Specials, MGM Home Entertainment, MGM Movie Time
['New!!! VHS TAPE Sealed (as shown) "The Soldier [VHS]" Fast shipping..(DC-3)']
{'Package Dimensions': '7.32 x 4.19 x 1.12 inches; 6.13 Ounces', 'Director': 'James Glickenhaus', 'Run time': '1 hour and 36 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 6, 1999', 'Date First Available': 'September 29, 2006', 'Actors': 'Ken Wahl, Alberta Watson, Jeremiah Sullivan, William Prince, Klaus Kinski', 'Studio': 'Fox Home Entertainme'}
Back in the 80s when this was made, i think it was a pretty good flick, it has a weak plot though and some areas could have been expanded upon. But the idea of this movie is so original, I like the idea of our guys stealing one of our own nukes to threaten the Russians who stole some of our nuclear fuel to make a bomb and put it in the Saudi oil fields in an attempt to get the Israeli's off the west bank. It feels like a class B movie, but it is enjoyable all the same. This movie would make a great remake if done today, and considering some of the garbage that has been released lately, this one would be a big hit.
Great concept for storyline

profile:
The user maintains a passionate interest in movies, particularly those from the 1980s and 1990s, with a penchant for action and thriller genres. They exhibit a strong appreciation for original storylines, valuing creativity and unique concepts over technical execution, suggesting a preference for films that offer innovative twists. Their recent purchase of a DVD highlights their nostalgic attachment to classic cinema and eagerness to revisit beloved films, as well as their openness to different formats.

Their review demonstrates a critical yet positive approach, celebrating films they adore while acknowledging their flaws. The user enjoys films that evoke nostalgia and stimulate discussions around themes and storytelling, indicating an affinity for cult classics. They seem receptive to remakes of older films, reflecting a belief in the potential for contemporary interpretations of cherished narratives. Overall, the user’s profile is characterized by a blend of themed creativity appreciation and a thoughtful engagement with cinematic works, prioritizing meaningful narratives and emotional connections in their viewing experiences.
